fields_of_interest: Environment, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Research and innovation, Public Health, Food Safety
eu_initiatives:
My organisation currently follow key environmental science challenges:  EU Commission on research and policy,  endocrine disrupter chemicals, chemical mixtures, chemical exposure, microplastics in the aquatic environment, ecosystems services, fisheries and aquaculture, pollination and chemicals, eco-toxicology testing, risk assessment of emerging chemical contaminants, omics technology and chemical risk assessment, Weight of evidence, Bioconcentration/ Bioaccumulation of chemicals, Population modelling, Nanotechnology 
•    Conceptualisation and development of tools and mathematical models for risk assessment 
•    Workshops bringing together different government agencies as well as scientists from industry and academia  
•    Co-ordination of data with the regulators, industry, academics and researchers to ensure that scientific evidence is used to provide the highest quality risk assessment of chemical products while minimising the use of animals in testing
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions

goals__remit: To contribute towards the improvement of environmental and Human health through knowledge transfer and interdisciplinary research and collaboration. Enhancing the quality of chemicals risk assessment so that chemicals management decisions are reliable and scientifically based.
relevant_communication:
Research Executive Agency - Marie Sklodowska-Curie and Horizon 2020, EuroMix, Euroecotox, “Transcript profiling in metamorphosis in halibut” (ARRDE Q5RS-2002-01192),     “Sex determining genes in the European sea bass” (PROBASS Q5RS-2000-31365 
European Commission discussions on Endocrine Disrupting chemicals, Non-monotonic and low dose for endocrine chemicals, REACH Targetted Risk Assessment and EchA Chessar
